Class Router.OutputPort

    • Field Detail

      • maxMismatchRatio

        double maxMismatchRatio
        Mismatch ratio of transmission speeds between the input and output links of this router. For example, a mismatch ratio of 10 means that the input link can transmit packets ten time faster than the output link. Because of this, the packets arriving at the router must enter the queue and wait for their turn for transmission on the output link. The default assumption is no mismatch (value 1.0), meaning that packets simply pass through the router without buffering.

      • mismatchCount

        double mismatchCount
        Counts how many packets to receive before one can be sent if the outgoing link is slower than incoming links.
        Different increments may be associated with different incoming links.
        See Also:
        handleIncomingPacket(NetworkElement, Packet)

      • outgoingLink

        Link outgoingLink
        The outgoing link associated with this output port.

      • packetInTransmission

        Packet packetInTransmission
        Holds the packet currently in transmission on the outgoing link. The packet will be handed over to its outgoing link when signaled

    • Constructor Detail

      • Router.OutputPort

        Router.OutputPort(Link outgoingLink_)
        Constructor for the inner class.
        Parameters:
        outgoingLink_ - the outgoing link with which this output port will be associated

    • Method Detail

      • calculateMismatchRatio

        protected double calculateMismatchRatio(Link incomingLink_)
        Helper method to calculate the mismatch ratio of an incoming and the outgoing link as:
         outgoingLinkTransmissionTime / incomingLinkTransmissionTime
        Parameters:
        incomingLink_ - incoming link to compare to
        Returns:
        the calculated mismatch ratio

      • handleIncomingPacket

        void handleIncomingPacket(NetworkElement source_,
                        Packet receivedPacket_)
        Handles an incoming packet that is heading out on this output port. The port can hold only the packet currently in transmission. Any other packets heading on this outgoing link must be queued in the router's memory, if the space permits. Otherwise, the packet will be dropped. Therefore, this method implements the drop-tail queue management policy.
        Parameters:
        source_ -  the communication link through which the packet arrived
        receivedPacket_ -  the packet that arrived on an incoming link

      • transmitPackets

        void transmitPackets()
        Transmits packets on the outgoing link. Should be called only when the time is right.
        See Also:
        Router.process(int)

      • updateMaxMismatchRatios

        void updateMaxMismatchRatios(java.util.Collection<Link> allLinks_)
        Calculates the maximum mismatch ratio for the associated outgoing link relative to all other (incoming) links.
        Parameters:
        allLinks_ - the list of all other incoming links
